item.title: Report E-2024090013
item.description:
Report E-2024090013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN1814 Cal Clean 947 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor. The crew advised the release occurred due to the valve being open. The valve was closed and tightened, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would be no further release. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents. All waste was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024090135
item.description:
Report X-2024090135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/23/2024 at approximately 1400, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5007286 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 1 fiberboard box that contained 3 plastic containers labeled as "Muriatic Acid". Dangerous Goods Administration obtained an online safety data sheet, which classified the commodity as UN 1789 Hydrochloric Acid. Two of the three containers leaked from the closure, resulting in spillage. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the requred markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The spillage also compromised the integrity of the shipping label and the outer package; however, the inner contents are being held, pending an FAA investigation. The shipment contained the identical contents as were reported in Spill Incident #20260. This shipper has been placed on embargo list.

item.title: Report E-2024090032
item.description:
Report E-2024090032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 22, 2024, one (1) 2-gallon jug of UN3149 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. Upon arrival, the crew discovered that terminal personnel had already deployed soda ash to the spill. MSES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3149-impacted dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024090134
item.description:
Report X-2024090134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/21/2024 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 317901 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting spillage from undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 3 - 1 gallon plastic containers packaging inside of a fiberboard box. Each plastic container contained muriatic acid. The shipment was discovered to a have spilled from the closure of each of the plastic containers. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it did not display the required markings, labeling, packaging and paparwork. The shipment has been place in a salvage drum and is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA. Upon release by the FAA, the shipment will be sent for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the loading process at the MEMH location a fiberboard box fell off the belt and was ran over by a dolly. All the containers inside were crushed releasing the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024081761
item.description:
Report X-2024081761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Railroad employee observed fresh liquid on the exterior of UTLX 662597 while switching the track. Car was isolated and a response contractor was called to investigate and repair the car. Contractor mounted the car and observed the manway nozzle gasket protruding unusually from the seat of the manway lid. Contractor opened the manway and noted the nozzle gasket was deteriorated and misaligned on the nozzle causing the release. A new nozzle gasket was installed and the manway was properly secured.

item.title: Report I-2024080087
item.description:
Report I-2024080087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: Memphis
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Flight Attendants first noticed an electrical burning smell around row 34-36 on the aircraft. Customer in 36D with an unknown brand of vape reported to the Flight Attendants that his vape was getting extremely hot to the touch. Flight Attendants placed the vape in a fire containment bag with some water. The flight landed shortly thereafter in MEM and the fire containment bag was handed over to ARFF by the Flight Attendants.
